title: I005: Add owner references GC chain E2E tests
description:
**Size:** ðŸ“¦ medium
**Category:** testing
**Priority:** medium
**Source:** Proposed for 'E2E tests with chainsaw are now working. Analysis'

Add 1 comprehensive Chainsaw E2E test that validates owner references on ALL operator-managed resources:

**test/e2e/owner-references/**: Create a CR with monitoring + PDB + NetworkPolicy all enabled to maximize child resource creation. Explicitly assert `ownerReferences` on every child resource:
- Deployment: ownerReference with correct owner UID, kind=Memcached, name matches CR
- Service: same ownerReference assertions
- PodDisruptionBudget: same ownerReference assertions
- NetworkPolicy: same ownerReference assertions
- ServiceMonitor: same ownerReference assertions

This validates the Kubernetes garbage collection chain â€” when the parent CR is deleted, all child resources must be cleaned up. The existing cr-deletion test verifies deletion happens, but this test explicitly verifies the mechanism (ownerReferences) is correctly set on creation.

**Rationale:** Owner references are the foundation of Kubernetes garbage collection. If any child resource lacks correct ownerReferences, it becomes orphaned on CR deletion, leading to resource leaks. The existing cr-deletion test only checks the end result, not the mechanism. Explicit ownerReference validation catches bugs in new resource creation code paths before they cause orphaned resources in production.

**Affected Areas:**
- test/e2e/owner-references/chainsaw-test.yaml

stories.title: Operator developer verifies GC chain is correctly set on all child resources
stories.want: to run an E2E test that asserts ownerReferences on every operator-managed resource
stories.so_that: I can catch missing ownerReferences before they cause orphaned resources in production
criteria: Chainsaw test creates a Memcached CR with monitoring, PDB, and NetworkPolicy all enabled
Assertions verify ownerReferences on Deployment, Service, PDB, NetworkPolicy, and ServiceMonitor
Each ownerReference assertion checks kind=Memcached, apiVersion=memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1, name matches CR, controller=true, blockOwnerDeletion=true
Test passes when run via `make test-e2e` against a kind cluster with operator deployed

stories.title: Operator developer detects missing ownerReferences on new resource types
stories.want: the E2E test to fail if a new child resource is created without SetControllerReference
stories.so_that: regressions in owner reference setup are caught during CI before merge
criteria: If Deployment is missing ownerReferences, the Deployment assertion step fails with a clear Chainsaw error
If ServiceMonitor is missing ownerReferences, the ServiceMonitor assertion step fails
If NetworkPolicy is missing ownerReferences, the NetworkPolicy assertion step fails
Failure message indicates which resource and which field did not match

stories.title: Operator developer distinguishes GC mechanism test from GC outcome test
stories.want: the owner-references test to validate the mechanism (ownerReferences set on creation) separately from the cr-deletion test that validates the outcome (resources cleaned up on deletion)
stories.so_that: I can pinpoint whether a GC failure is due to missing ownerReferences or a different Kubernetes issue
criteria: owner-references test only asserts ownerReferences are set â€” does NOT delete the CR
cr-deletion test remains unchanged and continues to test deletion behavior
Both tests can run independently in any order

stories.title: Operator developer sees all 5 managed resources validated in a single test
stories.want: one comprehensive test that covers all 5 resource types rather than separate tests per resource
stories.so_that: I get full GC chain coverage without test suite bloat
criteria: Single chainsaw-test.yaml with one CR creation and 5 assertion steps
CR enables all optional features (monitoring, PDB, NetworkPolicy) to maximize child resource count
Test follows existing naming conventions: test/e2e/owner-references/ directory

stories.title: E2E documentation is updated to include the owner-references test
stories.want: the Chainsaw E2E reference documentation updated with the new owner-references test
stories.so_that: the docs remain complete and accurate for all test scenarios
criteria: docs/reference/backend/chainsaw-e2e-tests.md includes the owner-references test in the file structure table
Test description and step breakdown documented following existing doc format
Requirement coverage matrix updated to reference owner-references test

requirements.description: The test SHALL create a Memcached CR that enables monitoring, PDB, and NetworkPolicy to produce all 5 managed resource types
requirements.rationale: All 5 resource types must exist so their ownerReferences can be asserted

scenarios.name: CR enables all optional features
scenarios.when: the 00-memcached.yaml is applied to the cluster
scenarios.then: the operator creates Deployment, Service, PDB, NetworkPolicy, and ServiceMonitor
and_then: all 5 resources exist in the test namespace with name matching CR name

scenarios.name: CR uses minimal resource requirements
scenarios.then: resource requests/limits are small enough for kind cluster (cpu:50m, memory:64Mi)
and_then: pods can schedule on a resource-constrained kind node

scenarios.name: Deployment reaches ready state
scenarios.when: the CR is applied and pods are scheduled
scenarios.then: the Deployment shows readyReplicas matching spec.replicas within 120s assert timeout
and_then: subsequent ownerReference assertions run against stable resources

requirements.description: The test SHALL assert ownerReferences on the Deployment include kind=Memcached, apiVersion=memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1, name matching CR, controller=true, blockOwnerDeletion=true
requirements.rationale: Deployment is the primary child resource; missing ownerReferences would orphan pods and ReplicaSets

scenarios.name: Deployment has correct ownerReference
scenarios.when: the Deployment is created by the operator
scenarios.then: metadata.ownerReferences contains an entry with kind=Memcached, apiVersion=memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1, name=test-owner-refs, controller=true, blockOwnerDeletion=true
and_then: Chainsaw partial match succeeds for the ownerReferences array

scenarios.name: Deployment assertion fails if ownerReference is missing
scenarios.when: the Deployment exists but lacks ownerReferences (hypothetical regression)
scenarios.then: the Chainsaw assert step fails with timeout waiting for ownerReferences to appear
and_then: test reports failure on the assert-deployment step

requirements.description: The test SHALL assert ownerReferences on the Service with the same fields as REQ-OR-002
requirements.rationale: Orphaned headless Service would leave stale DNS entries for deleted Memcached instances

scenarios.name: Service has correct ownerReference
scenarios.when: the Service is created by the operator
scenarios.then: metadata.ownerReferences contains an entry with kind=Memcached, apiVersion=memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1, name=test-owner-refs, controller=true, blockOwnerDeletion=true

scenarios.name: Service assertion covers headless ClusterIP
scenarios.when: the Service assertion file is evaluated
scenarios.then: it also asserts clusterIP=None to confirm correct Service type alongside ownerReferences

requirements.description: The test SHALL assert ownerReferences on the PodDisruptionBudget with the same fields as REQ-OR-002
requirements.rationale: Orphaned PDB would incorrectly constrain node drains for a non-existent workload

scenarios.name: PDB has correct ownerReference
scenarios.when: the PDB is created by the operator
scenarios.then: metadata.ownerReferences contains an entry with kind=Memcached, apiVersion=memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1, name=test-owner-refs, controller=true, blockOwnerDeletion=true

scenarios.name: PDB spec is also validated
scenarios.when: the PDB assertion file is evaluated
scenarios.then: it asserts minAvailable: 1 alongside ownerReferences to confirm correct PDB configuration

requirements.description: The test SHALL assert ownerReferences on the NetworkPolicy with the same fields as REQ-OR-002
requirements.rationale: Orphaned NetworkPolicy would block traffic to pods that no longer exist or, worse, apply to unrelated pods

scenarios.name: NetworkPolicy has correct ownerReference
scenarios.when: the NetworkPolicy is created by the operator
scenarios.then: metadata.ownerReferences contains an entry with kind=Memcached, apiVersion=memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1, name=test-owner-refs, controller=true, blockOwnerDeletion=true

scenarios.name: NetworkPolicy spec is also validated
scenarios.when: the NetworkPolicy assertion file is evaluated
scenarios.then: it asserts podSelector and ingress port 11211 alongside ownerReferences

requirements.description: The test SHALL assert ownerReferences on the ServiceMonitor with the same fields as REQ-OR-002
requirements.rationale: Orphaned ServiceMonitor would generate scrape errors in Prometheus for non-existent targets

scenarios.name: ServiceMonitor has correct ownerReference
scenarios.when: the ServiceMonitor is created by the operator
scenarios.then: metadata.ownerReferences contains an entry with kind=Memcached, apiVersion=memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1, name=test-owner-refs, controller=true, blockOwnerDeletion=true

scenarios.name: ServiceMonitor labels are also validated
scenarios.when: the ServiceMonitor assertion file is evaluated
scenarios.then: it asserts standard labels (app.kubernetes.io/name, instance, managed-by) alongside ownerReferences

requirements.description: The test SHALL follow existing Chainsaw test conventions: file naming (00-/01- prefixes), timeout configuration, and partial object matching
requirements.rationale: Consistency with existing 21 tests ensures maintainability and predictable behavior

scenarios.name: Files follow naming convention
scenarios.then: it contains chainsaw-test.yaml, 00-memcached.yaml, and 01-assert-*.yaml files following existing prefix conventions

scenarios.name: Timeouts match project defaults
scenarios.then: timeouts are apply:30s, assert:120s, delete:30s, error:30s matching .chainsaw.yaml and existing tests

scenarios.name: Test uses partial object matching
scenarios.when: assertion files are evaluated by Chainsaw
scenarios.then: only specified fields are validated (ownerReferences, key metadata, key spec fields) â€” not the full resource spec

requirements.description: The E2E reference documentation SHALL be updated to include the owner-references test scenario
requirements.rationale: docs/reference/backend/chainsaw-e2e-tests.md must remain the authoritative reference for all E2E tests

scenarios.name: File structure table updated
scenarios.when: a developer reads the E2E test documentation
scenarios.then: the file structure section lists test/e2e/owner-references/ with all files and their purposes

scenarios.name: Test scenario documented
scenarios.when: a developer reads the test scenario section
scenarios.then: owner-references test is documented with description, steps, and what each assertion validates

scenarios.name: Requirement coverage updated
scenarios.when: a developer reviews the coverage matrix
scenarios.then: the owner-references test is listed as covering ownerReference validation for all 5 resource types

tasks.title: Create Memcached CR YAML with all features enabled (REQ-OR-001)
tasks.description: Create `test/e2e/owner-references/00-memcached.yaml` â€” a Memcached CR named `test-owner-refs` with monitoring enabled (serviceMonitor with additionalLabels), PDB enabled (minAvailable: 1), and NetworkPolicy enabled. Use minimal resource requests (cpu:50m, memory:64Mi) matching existing test patterns from cr-deletion/00-memcached.yaml. Set replicas: 2 to exercise PDB meaningfully.

tasks.title: Create Deployment ownerReferences assertion file (REQ-OR-002)
tasks.description: Create `test/e2e/owner-references/01-assert-deployment.yaml` â€” partial Deployment object asserting metadata.ownerReferences array contains entry with kind: Memcached, apiVersion: memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1, name: test-owner-refs, controller: true, blockOwnerDeletion: true. Also assert replicas: 2 and readyReplicas: 2 in status to confirm Deployment is healthy.

tasks.title: Create Service ownerReferences assertion file (REQ-OR-003)
tasks.description: Create `test/e2e/owner-references/01-assert-service.yaml` â€” partial Service object asserting metadata.ownerReferences with same fields as Deployment assertion. Also assert clusterIP: None and port 11211 to confirm correct Service type.

tasks.title: Create PDB ownerReferences assertion file (REQ-OR-004)
tasks.description: Create `test/e2e/owner-references/01-assert-pdb.yaml` â€” partial PodDisruptionBudget object asserting metadata.ownerReferences with same fields. Also assert spec.minAvailable: 1.

tasks.title: Create NetworkPolicy ownerReferences assertion file (REQ-OR-005)
tasks.description: Create `test/e2e/owner-references/01-assert-networkpolicy.yaml` â€” partial NetworkPolicy object asserting metadata.ownerReferences with same fields. Also assert podSelector matchLabels and ingress port 11211.

tasks.title: Create ServiceMonitor ownerReferences assertion file (REQ-OR-006)
tasks.description: Create `test/e2e/owner-references/01-assert-servicemonitor.yaml` â€” partial ServiceMonitor object asserting metadata.ownerReferences with same fields. Also assert standard labels (app.kubernetes.io/name: memcached, app.kubernetes.io/instance: test-owner-refs, app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: memcached-operator).

tasks.title: Create chainsaw-test.yaml orchestrating CR creation and all 5 assertions (REQ-OR-007)
tasks.description: Create `test/e2e/owner-references/chainsaw-test.yaml` with test name 'owner-references'. Steps: (1) apply 00-memcached.yaml, (2) assert Deployment ready (01-assert-deployment.yaml), (3) assert Service ownerReferences (01-assert-service.yaml), (4) assert PDB ownerReferences (01-assert-pdb.yaml), (5) assert NetworkPolicy ownerReferences (01-assert-networkpolicy.yaml), (6) assert ServiceMonitor ownerReferences (01-assert-servicemonitor.yaml). Use standard timeouts: apply:30s, assert:120s. Description references owner reference GC chain validation.

tasks.title: Update E2E reference documentation with owner-references test (REQ-OR-008)
tasks.description: Update `docs/reference/backend/chainsaw-e2e-tests.md`: (1) Add owner-references/ to the file structure table with all 7 files listed, (2) Add a test scenario section documenting the test description, steps, and what each assertion validates (ownerReferences fields), (3) Update the requirement coverage matrix to include owner-references test covering GC chain validation for all 5 resource types. Follow the existing documentation format and heading structure.

test_specifications.expected: Deployment metadata.ownerReferences contains entry with kind=Memcached, apiVersion=memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1, name=test-owner-refs, controller=true, blockOwnerDeletion=true

test_specifications.story: Operator developer verifies GC chain is correctly set on all child resources
test_specifications.expected: Service metadata.ownerReferences contains entry with kind=Memcached, apiVersion=memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1, name=test-owner-refs, controller=true, blockOwnerDeletion=true

test_specifications.story: Operator developer verifies GC chain is correctly set on all child resources
test_specifications.expected: PodDisruptionBudget metadata.ownerReferences contains entry with kind=Memcached, controller=true, blockOwnerDeletion=true

test_specifications.story: Operator developer verifies GC chain is correctly set on all child resources
test_specifications.expected: NetworkPolicy metadata.ownerReferences contains entry with kind=Memcached, controller=true, blockOwnerDeletion=true

test_specifications.story: Operator developer verifies GC chain is correctly set on all child resources
test_specifications.expected: ServiceMonitor metadata.ownerReferences contains entry with kind=Memcached, controller=true, blockOwnerDeletion=true

test_specifications.story: Operator developer sees all 5 managed resources validated in a single test
test_specifications.expected: CR with monitoring+PDB+NetworkPolicy enabled is applied successfully, Deployment reaches readyReplicas=2

review_criteria: All 5 assertion files (Deployment, Service, PDB, NetworkPolicy, ServiceMonitor) assert ownerReferences with kind=Memcached, apiVersion=memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1, name=test-owner-refs, controller=true, blockOwnerDeletion=true
CR YAML enables monitoring (enabled: true, serviceMonitor with additionalLabels), PDB (enabled: true, minAvailable: 1), and NetworkPolicy (enabled: true) to produce all 5 resource types
Test follows existing Chainsaw conventions: file naming (00-/01- prefixes), timeout values (apply:30s, assert:120s), partial object matching, test metadata name format
Test does NOT delete the CR â€” it only validates ownerReferences are set on creation, complementing the existing cr-deletion test
Resource requests are minimal (cpu:50m, memory:64Mi) to ensure pods can schedule on resource-constrained kind clusters
docs/reference/backend/chainsaw-e2e-tests.md is updated with file structure, test scenario description, and requirement coverage for the owner-references test
implementation_notes: This test validates the mechanism (ownerReferences) rather than the outcome (garbage collection) of Kubernetes resource cleanup. The operator sets ownerReferences via `controllerutil.SetControllerReference()` in `internal/controller/reconcile_resource.go:46` for ALL managed resources. Chainsaw's partial object matching allows asserting specific ownerReferences fields without knowing the UID at test-write time â€” Chainsaw matches array entries by matching fields, so we assert kind, apiVersion, name, controller, and blockOwnerDeletion. The UID is dynamic and cannot be hardcoded, but Chainsaw will verify the ownerReference entry exists with all specified fields regardless of UID value. The CR is modeled after `test/e2e/cr-deletion/00-memcached.yaml` but adds NetworkPolicy enablement (`security.networkPolicy.enabled: true`) to cover all 5 resource types. Test name `test-owner-refs` follows the `test-{feature}` naming pattern used across all E2E tests.
